Getting Started¶

Author:Michal Hordecki
Release:0.3
Date:January 22, 2009

Hello! Thanks you for downloading 2x2x2 Explorer.

2x2x2 Explorer is a programming library aiming to aid with developing new Pocket Cube methods and with 2x2x2-oriented development overall.

Explorer is written in C++ and is covered by MIT License. Use it freely.

Learning process¶

2x2x2 Explorer is a really small library, easy to learn and develop with.

Recommended learning curve:

  1. Learn about 2x2x2 Explorer

    System Message: WARNING/2 (/root/Prog/Kostka/Explorer/docs/source/intro.rst)

    undefined label: fundamentals – if you don’t give a link caption the label must precede a section header.
    .
  2. Get in touch with

    System Message: WARNING/2 (/root/Prog/Kostka/Explorer/docs/source/intro.rst)

    undefined label: traversal – if you don’t give a link caption the label must precede a section header.
    classes.
  3. Read some examples placed in examples/ directory.
  4. When in doubt, refer to Explorer.

Installing 2x2x2 Explorer¶

To install 2x2x2 Explorer, be sure that you have working programming environment on your computer. 2x2x2 Explorer is written with GCC in mind, but it will probably run flawlessly on other platforms, too.

Using 2x2x2 Explorer - guidelines¶

There are a few things that need to be considered during development with 2x2x2 Explorer.

  • To include 2x2x2 Explorer’s header file, type::

    #include <222Explorer/222Explorer.h>

  • You need to link your application against 222explorer library (in G++, pass -l222explorer flag to linker)

  • All 2x2x2 Explorer files are placed in Explorer namespace

  • Be sure to call Explorer::init() at the beginning of your program.
